name: ext_R5_MedicationRequest_effectiveDosePeriod
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.MedicationRequest.effectiveDosePeriod for use in FHIR R4B
description: This cross-version extension represents MedicationRequest.effectiveDosePeriod from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/MedicationRequest|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4B.

element.short: Period over which the medication is to be taken
element.definition: The period over which the medication is to be taken.  Where there are multiple dosageInstruction lines (for example, tapering doses), this is the earliest date and the latest end date of the dosageInstructions.
element.comment: `MedicationRequest.effectiveDosePeriod` has no related element in R4B:MedicationRequest

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children unless an empty Parameters resource
constraint.expression: hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()) or $this is Parameters

constraint.human: Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
